meanings.sent1: After dinner, Mom had to recook the pasta because it got cold.

meanings.sent3: When the chef forgot to add salt to the soup, he had to recook it to fix the taste.

meanings.definition: To prepare (food) again by heating or boiling.
meanings.sent1: If the soup is too cold, you can recook it on the stove for a few minutes.
meanings.sent2: When the stew cooled down, I had to recook it to serve it hot.
meanings.sent3: The burnt cookies were so hard that even recooking them couldn't save them.
meanings.sent4: She had to recook the rice to make it fluffy and delicious.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to recook the sauce to thicken it before serving.
